newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK people show less confidence in handover - poll.
newsitem.headline: HK people show less confidence in handover - poll.

text.p: Hong Kong people's confidence in their future as part of China dropped considerably on the eve of the territory's handover, according to a poll by a newspaper on Monday.

The poll, by the Chinese-language Apple Daily newspaper and the Chinese University of Hong Kong last Monday and Tuesday, showed waning confidence in China's promise of "one country two systems" and "Hong Kong people rule Hong Kong".
Altogether 618 people were interviewed and the results were compared against similar polls done over the past few months.
The number of people who said they had less confidence in China's promises had grown from 12.9 per cent last month to 24.2 per cent this month.
More people said they were pessimistic about the future. The number had risen from 15.1 percent in February to 20.8 percent this month.
The number of people who believed they would have more democracy fell from last month's 7.3 percent to 3.4 percent.
Similar pessimism was recorded on the future of human rights and basic freedoms.
A British colony for 156 years, Hong Kong will revert to China at midnight Monday.
